name: search
description:
Universal file search tool for Linux

Current Implementation:
Using locate with Unix-style search capabilities

Search Syntax Guide:
Linux Locate Search Syntax:

Basic Usage:
- Simple pattern: locate filename
- Case-insensitive: -i pattern
- Regular expressions: -r pattern
- Existing files only: -e pattern
- Count matches: -c pattern

Pattern Wildcards:
- * matches any characters
- ? matches single character
- [] matches character classes

Examples:
- locate -i "*.pdf"
- locate -r "/home/.*\.txt$"
- locate -c "*.doc"
